topic: Cold War

questions.question: The Cold War was a geopolitical rivalry between two countries: the USA and the Soviet Union.
Cold War begun around 1950, with the introduction of the Truman Doctrine and the Marshall Plan.
In 1949 the United States and its European allies formed the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) to protect each in case of attack.

The United States did not want communism to spread to other countries in Europe. The United States therefore gave money to those countries to rebuild after the war. This was called the Marshall Plan after George Marshall, the American who proposed the plan.
The Cold War ended in 1980, after the collapse and dissolution of the Soviet Union.

topic: The Russian Revolution: 1917-1922

questions.question: Before the revolution, Russia was ruled by a powerful monarch called the Tsar. The Tsar had total power in Russia.
Russian revolution was led by Vladimir Lenin and a group of revolutionaries called the Bolsheviks.

From 1918 to 1920, Russia experienced a civil war between the Bolsheviks (also called the Red Army) and the anti-Bolsheviks (the White Army). The Bolsheviks won and the new country was called the USSR (Union of Soviet Socialist Republics).
The people of Russia first revolted in early 1927.
